name: Acamprosate

dosing.adult_acute: 666 mg TID (≥60 kg); 333-666 mg TID (<60 kg)
dosing.notes: Take with meals. Begin after alcohol withdrawal is complete. Does not treat withdrawal symptoms. Works best in patients with goal of abstinence. Continue for up to 1 year.

canadian_clinical.starting_dose: 666 mg TID (≥60kg); reduce to 333-666 mg TID if <60 kg.
canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: No titration; start at full dose after detoxification is complete.
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Initiate after acute alcohol withdrawal managed. Start full dose prior to discharge.
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Initiate when abstinence achieved. Combine with behavioral therapy. Follow up monthly initially.

cautions.renal: Reduce dose if CrCl 30-50: 333 mg TID. Contraindicated if CrCl <30.
cautions.hepatic: No dose adjustment required — not significantly hepatically metabolized.

warnings: Suicidal ideation reported — monitor mental health
Not effective during active drinking — used for maintaining abstinence
